channel.title: HL1 remastered (and then some) *sorry Bloodshot >.>
channel.description:
If I'd have known someone was working on this, I'd have just contacted them and set up a merge or something :T
Ah well, this is a sound pack that replaces all the weapon fire sounds, the explosions, and some NPCs (vort, zombie, houndeye) with remastered HL1 sounds. When I say remastered, I mean either mixed with BM, heavily edited valve 98 originals, or from scratch recordings made to emulate the spirit of the 98 sounds. Some stuff is straight up redone conceptually (zombie melee)
I plan on touching up the Agrunt as well in the future. It needs some real serious touching.
[url='https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EFRq_vNZt_U&feature=youtu.be']Here's a vid of the pack in action[/url]
[url='https://dl.dropbox.com/u/3534549/sounds/BMS.rar']And here's the pack![/url] Just drag the BMS into source mods, and let it merge and replace anything it asks you to merge and replace. The pack comes with the vanilla BM sounds inside each folder so uninstallation is easy. If this is an issue, someone just hit me up and I'll take em out.

item.title: HL1 remastered (and then some) *sorry Bloodshot >.>
item.dc:creator: Bloodshot
item.description:
lol don’t worry about it, I just did some stuff for myself and figured I’d release what I had.

It’s funny, like literally 10 minutes ago I decided the MP5 was missing something so I took the “shell casings hitting the floor” parts of the original sound, and combined them with the BM firing sound in pretty much the same way

I really loved hearing that after I stopped firing in the original so I just couldn’t leave it be.

The only thing I’d say (which is why I didn’t do this) is that the HL1 glock firing sound is probably the most unfitting of them all. For some reason it just seems like the type of sound that is easier to notice how much lower quality it is than the rest.

I loled @ the sound when you hit the zombie with the crowbar :lol:
